   19: %%
   20: -module(error_logger_h_SUITE).
   21: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   22: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2]).
   23: -export([logfile/1,logfile_truncated/1,tty/1,tty_truncated/1]).
   24: 
   25: %% Event handler exports.
   26: -export([init/1,handle_event/2,terminate/2]).
   27: 
   28: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   29: 
   30: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   31: 
   32: all() ->
   33:     [logfile,logfile_truncated,tty,tty_truncated].
   34: 
   35: groups() ->
   36:     [].
   37: 
   38: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   39:     Config.
   40: 
   41: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   42:     ok.
   43: 
   44: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   45:     Config.
   46: 
   47: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   48:     Config.
   49: 
   50: logfile(Config) ->
   51:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   52:     LogDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE),
   53:     Log = filename:join(LogDir, "logfile.log"),
   54:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Log),
   55: 
   56:     Ev = event_templates(),
   57: 
   58:     do_one_logfile(Log, Ev, unlimited),
   59: 
   60:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
   61:     error_logger:logfile({open,Log}),
   62:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun gen_events/1,[Ev]]),
   63:     AtNode = iolist_to_binary(["** at node ",atom_to_list(Node)," **"]),
   64:     timer:sleep(1000), % some time get all log events in the log
   65:     error_logger:logfile(close),
   66:     analyse_events(Log, Ev, [AtNode], unlimited),
   67: 
   68:     %% Make sure that the file_io_server process has been stopped
   69:     [] = lists:filtermap(fun(X) ->
   70:         case process_info(X, [current_function]) of
   71:             [{current_function, {file_io_server, _, _}}] ->
   72:                 case file:pid2name(X) of
   73:                     {ok, Log} -> {true, {X, Log}};
   74:                     _ -> false
   75:                 end;
   76:             _ ->
   77:                 false
   78:         end
   79:     end, processes()),
   80: 
   81:     peer:stop(Peer),
   82: 
   83:     cleanup(Log),
   84:     ok.
   85: 
   86: logfile_truncated(Config) ->
   87:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   88:     LogDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE),
   89:     Log = filename:join(LogDir, "logfile_truncated.log"),
   90:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Log),
   91: 
   92:     Ev = event_templates(),
   93: 
   94:     Depth = 20,
   95:     application:set_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth, Depth),
   96:     try
   97: 	do_one_logfile(Log, Ev, Depth)
   98:     after
   99: 	application:unset_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth)
  100:     end,
  101: 
  102:     cleanup(Log),
  103:     ok.
  104: 
  105: do_one_logfile(Log, Ev, Depth) ->
  106:     error_logger:logfile({open,Log}),
  107:     gen_events(Ev),
  108:     error_logger:logfile(close),
  109:     analyse_events(Log, Ev, [], Depth).
  110: 
  111: tty(Config) ->
  112:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  113:     LogDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE),
  114:     Log = filename:join(LogDir, "tty.log"),
  115:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Log),
  116: 
  117:     Ev = event_templates(),
  118: 
  119:     do_one_tty(Log, Ev, unlimited),
  120: 
  121:     {ok,Peer,Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  122:     tty_log_open(Log),
  123:     ok = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [fun gen_events/1,[Ev]]),
  124:     tty_log_close(),
  125:     AtNode = iolist_to_binary(["** at node ",atom_to_list(Node)," **"]),
  126:     timer:sleep(1000), % some time get all log events in the log
  127:     analyse_events(Log, Ev, [AtNode], unlimited),
  128: 
  129:     peer:stop(Peer),
  130: 
  131:     cleanup(Log),
  132:     ok.
  133: 
  134: tty_truncated(Config) ->
  135:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  136:     LogDir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?MODULE),
  137:     Log = filename:join(LogDir, "tty_truncated.log"),
  138:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Log),
  139: 
  140:     Ev = event_templates(),
  141: 
  142:     Depth = 20,
  143:     application:set_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth, Depth),
  144:     try
  145:        do_one_tty(Log, Ev, Depth)
  146:     after
  147: 	application:unset_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth)
  148:     end,
  149: 
  150:     cleanup(Log),
  151:     ok.
  152: 
  153: do_one_tty(Log, Ev, Depth) ->
  154:     tty_log_open(Log),
  155:     gen_events(Ev),
  156:     tty_log_close(),
  157:     analyse_events(Log, Ev, [], Depth).
  158: 
  159: tty_log_open(Log) ->
  160:     {ok,Fd} = file:open(Log, [write]),
  161:     Depth = case application:get_env(kernel, error_logger_format_depth) of
  162: 		{ok,D} -> D;
  163: 		_ -> unlimited
  164: 	    end,
  165:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, {Fd,Depth,latin1}),
  166:     Fd.
  167: 
  168: tty_log_close() ->
  169:     error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
  170:     ok.
  171: 
  172: event_templates() ->
  173:     [{error_msg,["Pure error string\n",[]]},
  174:      {error_msg,["Pure error string with error ~p\n",[]]},
  175:      {error_msg,["Error string with ~p\n", [format]]},
  176:      {error_msg,["Error string with bad format ~p\n", []]},
  177: 
  178:      {error_report,[error_atom]},
  179:      {error_report,["error string"]},
  180:      {error_report,[[{error_tag,value},error_value]]},
  181: 
  182:      {info_msg,["Pure info string\n",[]]},
  183:      {info_msg,["Pure info string with error ~p\n",[]]},
  184:      {info_msg,["Pure string with ~p\n", [format]]},
  185:      {info_msg,["Pure string with bad format ~p\n", []]},
  186: 
  187:      {info_report,[info_atom]},
  188:      {info_report,["info string"]},
  189:      {info_report,[[{info_tag,value},info_value]]},
  190: 
  191:      {warning_msg,["Pure warning string\n",[]]},
  192:      {warning_msg,["Pure warning string with error ~p\n",[]]},
  193:      {warning_msg,["Warning string with ~p\n", [format]]},
  194:      {warning_msg,["Warning string with bad format ~p\n", []]},
  195: 
  196:      {warning_report,[warning_atom]},
  197:      {warning_report,["warning string"]},
  198:      {warning_report,[[{warning_tag,value},warning_value]]},
  199: 
  200:      %% Bigger terms.
  201:      {error_msg,["fairly big: ~p\n",[lists:seq(1, 128)]]},
  202:      {error_report,[list_to_tuple(lists:seq(1, 100))]},
  203:      {error_report,[lists:seq(32, 126)]},
  204:      {error_report,[[{tag,lists:seq(1, 64)}]]}
  205:     ].
  206: 
  207: gen_events(Ev) ->
  208:     io:format("node = ~p\n", [node()]),
  209:     io:format("group leader = ~p\n", [group_leader()]),
  210:     io:format("~p\n", [error_logger:which_report_handlers()]),
  211:     call_error_logger(Ev),
  212: 
  213:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> error(ouch) end),
  214:     receive
  215: 	{'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,_} ->
  216: 	    ok
  217:     end,
  218: 
  219:     %% The following calls with a custom type will be ignored.
  220:     error_logger:error_report(ignored, value),
  221:     error_logger:warning_report(ignored, value),
  222:     error_logger:info_report(ignored, value),
  223:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  224:     ok.
  225: 
  226: analyse_events(Log, Ev, AtNode, Depth) ->
  227:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(Log),
  228: 
  229:     io:format("*** Contents of log file ***\n\n~s\n", [Bin]),
  230: 
  231:     Lines = binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global,trim_all]),
  232:     io:format("~p\n", [Lines]),
  233: 
  234:     Rest = match_output(Ev, Lines, AtNode, Depth),
  235:     io:format("~p\n", [Rest]),
  236: 
  237:     [] = match_emulator_error(Rest),
  238:     ok.
  239: 
  240: 
  241: call_error_logger([{F,Args}|T]) ->
  242:     apply(error_logger, F, Args),
  243:     timer:sleep(10),
  244:     call_error_logger(T);
  245: call_error_logger([]) -> ok.
  246: 
  247: 
  248: match_emulator_error([Head,Second,Third,_|Lines]) ->
  249:     match_head(<<"ERROR">>, Head),
  250:     {match,[{0,_}]} = re:run(Second,
  251: 			   "^Error in process <\\d+[.]\\d+[.]\\d+> on "
  252: 			   "node [^ ]* with exit value:"),
  253:     {match,[{0,_}]} = re:run(Third, "^[{]ouch,"),
  254:     Lines.
  255: 
  256: match_output([Item|T], Lines0, AtNode, Depth) ->
  257:     try match_item(Item, Lines0, AtNode, Depth) of
  258: 	Lines ->
  259: 	    match_output(T, Lines, AtNode, Depth)
  260:     catch
  261: 	C:E:Stk ->
  262: 	    io:format("ITEM: ~p", [Item]),
  263: 	    io:format("LINES: ~p", [Lines0]),
  264: 	    erlang:raise(C, E, Stk)
  265:     end;
  266: match_output([], Lines, _, _) -> Lines.
  267: 
  268: match_item(Item, Lines, AtNode, Depth) ->
  269:     case item_type(Item) of
  270: 	{msg,Head,Args} ->
  271: 	    match_format(Head, Args, Lines, AtNode, Depth);
  272: 	{report,Head,Args} ->
  273: 	    match_term(Head, Args, Lines, AtNode, Depth)
  274:     end.
  275: 
  276: item_type({error_msg,Args}) ->
  277:     {msg,<<"ERROR">>,Args};
  278: item_type({info_msg,Args}) ->
  279:     {msg,<<"INFO">>,Args};
  280: item_type({warning_msg,Args}) ->
  281:     {msg,<<"WARNING">>,Args};
  282: item_type({error_report,Args}) ->
  283:     {report,<<"ERROR">>,Args};
  284: item_type({info_report,Args}) ->
  285:     {report,<<"INFO">>,Args};
  286: item_type({warning_report,Args}) ->
  287:     {report,<<"WARNING">>,Args}.
  288: 
  289: match_format(Tag, [Format,Args], [Head|Lines], AtNode, Depth) ->
  290:     match_head(Tag, Head),
  291:     Bin = try dl_format(Depth, Format, Args) of
  292: 	      Str ->
  293: 		  iolist_to_binary(Str)
  294:     catch
  295: 	_:_ ->
  296: 	    S = dl_format(Depth, "ERROR: ~p - ~p~n", [Format,Args]),
  297: 	    iolist_to_binary(S)
  298:     end,
  299:     Expected0 = binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global,trim]),
  300:     Expected = AtNode ++ Expected0,
  301:     match_term_lines(Expected, Lines).
  302: 
  303: match_term(Tag, [Arg], [Head|Lines], AtNode, Depth) ->
  304:     match_head(Tag, Head),
  305:     Expected0 = match_term_get_expected(Arg, Depth),
  306:     Expected = AtNode ++ Expected0,
  307:     match_term_lines(Expected, Lines).
  308: 
  309: match_term_get_expected(List, Depth) when is_list(List) ->
  310:     Bin = try iolist_to_binary(dl_format(Depth, "~s\n", [List])) of
  311: 	      Bin0 -> Bin0
  312: 	  catch
  313: 	      _:_ ->
  314: 		  iolist_to_binary(format_rep(List, Depth))
  315: 	  end,
  316:     binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global,trim]);
  317: match_term_get_expected(Term, Depth) ->
  318:     S = dl_format(Depth, "~p\n", [Term]),
  319:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(S),
  320:     binary:split(Bin, <<"\n">>, [global,trim]).
  321: 
  322: format_rep([{Tag,Data}|Rep], Depth) ->
  323:     [dl_format(Depth, "    ~p: ~p\n", [Tag,Data])|
  324:      format_rep(Rep, Depth)];
  325: format_rep([Other|Rep], Depth) ->
  326:     [dl_format(Depth, "    ~p\n", [Other])|
  327:      format_rep(Rep, Depth)];
  328: format_rep([], _Depth) -> [].
  329: 
  330: match_term_lines([Line|T], [Line|Lines]) ->
  331:     match_term_lines(T, Lines);
  332: match_term_lines([], Lines) -> Lines.
  333: 
  334: match_head(Tag, Head) ->
  335:     Re = <<"^=",Tag/binary,
  336: 	   " REPORT==== \\d\\d?-[A-Z][a-z][a-z]-\\d{4}::"
  337: 	   "\\d\\d:\\d\\d:\\d\\d ===$">>,
  338:     {match,_} = re:run(Head, Re).
  339: 
  340: cleanup(File) ->
  341:     %% The point of this test case is not to test file operations.
  342:     %% Therefore ignore any failures.
  343:     case file:delete(File) of
  344: 	ok ->
  345: 	    ok;
  346: 	{error,Error1} ->
  347: 	    io:format("file:delete(~s) failed with error ~p",
  348: 		      [File,Error1])
  349:     end,
  350:     Dir = filename:dirname(File),
  351:     case file:del_dir(Dir) of
  352: 	ok ->
  353: 	    ok;
  354: 	{error,Error2} ->
  355: 	    io:format("file:del_dir(~s) failed with error ~p",
  356: 		      [Dir,Error2])
  357:     end,
  358:     ok.
  359: 
  360: 
  361: %% Depth-limited io_lib:format. Intentionally implemented here instead
  362: %% of using io_lib:scan_format/2 to avoid using the same implementation
  363: %% as in the error_logger handlers.
  364: 
  365: dl_format(unlimited, Format, Args) ->
  366:     io_lib:format(Format, Args);
  367: dl_format(Depth, Format0, Args0) ->
  368:     {Format,Args} = dl_format_1(Format0, Args0, Depth, [], []),
  369:     io_lib:format(Format, Args).
  370: 
  371: dl_format_1("~p"++Fs, [A|As], Depth, Facc, Acc) ->
  372:     dl_format_1(Fs, As, Depth, [$P,$~|Facc], [Depth,A|Acc]);
  373: dl_format_1("~w"++Fs, [A|As], Depth, Facc, Acc) ->
  374:     dl_format_1(Fs, As, Depth, [$W,$~|Facc], [Depth,A|Acc]);
  375: dl_format_1("~s"++Fs, [A|As], Depth, Facc, Acc) ->
  376:     dl_format_1(Fs, As, Depth, [$s,$~|Facc], [A|Acc]);
  377: dl_format_1([F|Fs], As, Depth, Facc, Aacc) ->
  378:     dl_format_1(Fs, As, Depth, [F|Facc], Aacc);
  379: dl_format_1([], [], _, Facc, Aacc) ->
  380:     {lists:reverse(Facc),lists:reverse(Aacc)}.
  381: 
  382: %%%
  383: %%% Our own event handler. There is no way to intercept the output
  384: %%% from error_logger_tty_h, but we can use the same code by
  385: %%% calling error_logger_tty_h:write_event/2.
  386: %%%
  387: 
  388: init({_,_,_}=St) ->
  389:     {ok,St}.
  390: 
  391: handle_event(Event, {Fd,Depth,Enc}=St) ->
  392:     case error_logger_tty_h:write_event(tag_event(Event), io_lib, {Depth,Enc}) of
  393: 	ok ->
  394: 	    ok;
  395: 	Str when is_list(Str) ->
  396: 	    io:put_chars(Fd, Str)
  397:     end,
  398:     {ok,St}.
  399: 
  400: terminate(_Reason, {Fd,_,_}) ->
  401:     ok = file:close(Fd),
  402:     [].
  403: 
  404: tag_event(Event) ->
  405:     {erlang:universaltime(),Event}.
